alert.note: Alert for Ingham (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 10:26AM EDT until April 05 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County. .Rainfall over the past 24 hours has resulted in rises on area creeks and rivers. For the Red Cedar...including Williamston, East Lansing...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red Cedar River At East Lansing. * WHEN...From this morning to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of low lying areas, adjacent parks, and farmland. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 7.3 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.3 feet on 04/21/1993. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
